meanings.definition: Resembling or characteristic of Tartarus, the lowest region of the ancient Greek underworld.
meanings.sent1: The cave was so tartarous, it felt like entering the depths of the earth.
meanings.sent2: The painting depicted a tartarous landscape with fiery rivers and shadowy figures.
meanings.sent3: The tartarous clouds overhead seemed to whisper ancient secrets.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes held a tartarous depth, revealing hidden sorrows.
meanings.sent5: The old castle stood on the hill, its silhouette against the tartarous sky.

meanings.definition: Extremely dark, gloomy, or hellish in nature.
meanings.sent1: The forest at night was so tartarous that even the bravest souls hesitated to enter.
meanings.sent2: The abandoned house had a tartarous atmosphere, sending shivers down the spine.
meanings.sent3: The tartarous mood of the room made everyone feel uneasy.
meanings.sent4: His thoughts took a tartarous turn, dwelling on the darkest possibilities.
meanings.sent5: The alley was a tartarous maze of shadows, where fear lurked at every corner.
